dating.remarks: [Kunstsammlungen und Museen der Stadt Augsburg, revised 2016]

pageContext.description:
A half length portrait facing to the right. Sideburns. Black coat with a reddish-brown fur trimming, a brown hat. Four rings on his left hand. View of a mountainous landscape with a castle at the top right. 
[Maria Winner/Sarah Klein, Augsburg, 21. Nov. 2016]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 55 x 35.5 x 1.5 cm
Dimensions including frame: 67 x 49 x 5.5 cm
[Kunstsammlungen und Museen der Stadt Augsburg, revised 2016]
pageContext.markings:
Reverse of the panel:
- in white paint: 'Friedrich der Weise Churfürst von Sachsen geb. 17.1.1463,gest. 5.5.1525', 'Albrecht der Beherzte, reg. Herzog zu Sachsen geb. 27.7.1443, gest. 12.9.1500'
Label (without text), red seal, various remnants of labels  

Reverse of the frame: 
collection label; old, round label; bottom right: remnants of an old label 
[Kunstsammlungen und Museen der Stadt Augsburg, revised 2016]

pageContext.medium:
Painting on lime wood
[Kunstsammlungen und Museen der Stadt Augsburg, revised 2016]

Dimensions of support: 55 x 35.5 x 1.5 cm
Dimensions including frame: 67 x 49 x 5.5 cm

metadata.title: Elector Frederick III of Saxony

pageContext.provenance:
- in the collection of Christian Schuchardt, Weimar, about 1851
- in the collection of Prince Georg of Saxony, Sybillenort Castle near Dresden, about 1900
- private collection, Karl Haberstock, 1931
- Karl und Magdalene Haberstock-Stiftung, 1983.
- on loan to the Schaezlerpalais, Augsburg
[Kunstsammlungen und Museen der Stadt Augsburg, revised 2016]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
- the panel is warped and is fitted in a frame that accomodates this feature: with space at the top right and bottom left.
Paint Layers:
fine network of cracks, occasional discoloured retouches

Varnish:
thick, glossy and yellowed; three scratches (on the left sleeve and above)

tests.text:
- probably hardwood 
- a single plank with the grain running vertically, no plane marks
- reverse smooth
- painted edge visible on the left and right

- Original 
- numerous screw holes on the reverse 
- half-lap joints, probably original, formally with ornamented moulding, gilded, profile: smooth on the underside and sloping outwards

pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia at the top left: winged serpent with elevated wings
[Kunstsammlungen und Museen der Stadt Augsburg, revised 2016]
